thread.title: Ferrari Stock Soars as Its IPO Hits the Opening Trade - Yahoo Finance
thread.title_full: Ferrari Stock Soars as Its IPO Hits the Opening Trade - Yahoo Finance

author: Renee Blakely
title: Ferrari Stock Soars as Its IPO Hits the Opening Trade - Yahoo Finance
text:
Looking at SPY and EWU Ahead of the ECB's Meeting 
Ferrari made its stock market debut Ferrari, the sports car manufacturer, made its stock market debut with its shares surging 5.77% on October 21, its first trading day. Ferrari traded under the ticker symbol RACE. The Ferrari family owns a 10% stake in the luxury carmaker while remaining stake is owned by Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCAU). Fiat Chrysler is anticipated to sell a tenth of its stake in the brand to raise funds to bolster its own product investments.

Comparison The shares opened at a premium of about 15% after their sale on October 20 at $52 per share. The closing price of Ferrari (RACE) was $55 as of October 21.
The graph above shows the performances of the stocks that belong to other automobile manufacturers, including General Motors (GM) and Ford (F). We can see the rise in the stocks except for Fiat Chrysler, as of October 21. Delphi Automotive (DLPH) also fell by 0.44% on the day.
General Motors’ performance Shares of General Motors rose by 5.79% after the company reported its profit and revenues for the third quarter, beating market expectations. Earnings for the quarter ending September came out to be 84 cents per share compared to 81 cents per share for the same period a year ago. Meanwhile, adjusted earnings per share excluding non-recurring items were $1.50, beating a consensus estimate of $1.12. Similarly, revenue reported was $38.8 billion compared to the consensus of $37 billion.
General Motors traded at $35.42, beating its respective 100-day, 50-day, and 20-day moving averages and pointing its uptrend. Its trailing five-day and one-month returns as of October 21 were 6.27% and 17.95%, respectively. The beta for the stock is 1.03, almost in tandem with the market movement. On October 21, the volume of the stock surged from 11,848,337 stocks on the previous day to 37,243,555 stocks on Wednesday. General Motors earned 12 “buy,” 10 “hold,” and no “sell” recommendations. The stock is rated as “stable” by Standard & Poor’s and Moody’s.
In the next part, let’s look at the performances of the component sectors of the SPDR S&P 500 ETF (SPY).
Continue to Next Part
